headline: Chicken Noodle Soup
description: This chicken noodle soup recipe is easily made from scratch with vegetables, pasta, bouillon broth, and seasonings for a warm and satisfying meal.

video.description: See how to make simple chicken soup nearly from scratch.
video.name: Chicken Noodle Soup

name: Chicken Noodle Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large stockpot over medium-high heat. Sauté celery and onion in hot butter until slightly softened. Add water, chicken, bouillon, carrots, parsley, marjoram, pepper, and bay leaf. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir in noodles and simmer until pasta is tender, about 10 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: Its a dream. I didnt have bay leaf and marjoram, but its anyways very delicious.
Easy to make and tastes like you spent hours making it.

This is my go to Chicken Noodle Soup recipe. I have made it for ten years. I do make a few adjustments...I use a cup of carrots and double the amount of onions, which I sauté in the butter with the celery. This allows the carrots to soften up. I also use 6 cups chicken stock and 6 cups of chicken broth instead of the water and bouillon.
It was great. I added more carrot which adds a natural sweetness I like blended with the chicken.
I made this soup exactly by the recipe, and man oh man is it good?!?!
Loved it.
Yum yum yum!!!!
This was a hit with everyone in our family!

This recipe was bland when I used my homemade bone broth, since we don't add salt. So next time, I will need to add salt and maybe a little bit more of other seasonings. Otherwise, with added salt, it tasted really good.
great taste.
I made this for neighbors sick with the flu and Covid so I only got a taste. My neighbors raved about it. I used leftover turkey instead of chicken and was awesome.

My whole house is sick, and it's three days till Christmas. We are all now drinking cups full of this soup! Only added a little more of the onion, and spices. Added additional spices, including cayenne, thyme, & oregano. Also, I add a heaping spoon of minced garlic to most everything I cook! Added it here. I combined bouillon and can bone broth. All of the basics are left alone! I swear by this soup to help sickies feel better!
Add a bit more marjoram, used chicken stock rather than water and buoillon, and less stock. Yummy!

Wow this was way better than I imagined! I used 2 boxes chicken stock (8 cups) then used 4 cups water with 4 teaspoons of boullion powder. I used one whole Videlia onion, about 2 cups celery, and a cup of frozen peas. To really cut time as it was all I had on hand, I used pre-cooked fajita chicken strips which I chopped into small bite-size pieces. At the end I used a 12 oz package of egg noodles - which did drink a lot of the broth - but the family loves their pasta and I wanted it to go farther. I used all the other spices as listed. It took me 15 minutes to throw it together and I let it simmer for 2 hours then added pasta. Hubby is STILL raving about how it's the best soup he's ever had and what an amazing chef I am LOL!

This was very easy to make with simple ingredients. I used a lemon pepper rotisserie chicken from Publix, just cut the meat right off the bone. A whole chicken makes just the right amount for the recipe. As for the bay leaf, turns out it's optional. I forgot the bay leaf but soup tasted delicious anyway. My suggestion would be to prepare all the chopped ingredients the day or night before you want to cook. Otherwise the chopping will add another 30 minites to prep time.

Made this last night the only differences I did not use bullion cubes I just boiled my chicken and use the broth from that but that is my personal preference I don’t usually use bullion cubes because it leaves a film in your mouth

The best chicken noodle soup ever! I did as others suggested and followed the boiled chicken recipe from this site and used that stock for 1/3, then Swansons broth foe the rest. I more than doubled the veggies, added garlic, and sauteed lightly before adding the stock. Simmered for about an hour and added noodles and chicken for the last 10 mins. Delicious!
Followed directions and used boneless thigh meat and canned breast chicken. My grandkids liked it. It was easy and delicious on this very cold day before Mardi Gras in New Orleans.

Simple, delicious recipe! My only changes are to sauté chicken WITH the butter, onions (we don’t care for celery) and Totally Guacamole seasoning from The Nutmeg Spice Co (I put that on everything!). Then I add the water with 3.5 Tablespoons of chicken Better Than Bouillon. The rest is as written. Oh & I did double the noodles. I like more noodles
Simple ingredients and delicious soup! I like to shred the chicken before adding. My go to comfort soup!

Made a few tweaks. I didn't have marjoram so I used 1/2 tsp of each thyme, rosemary, and tarragon. I did not use any boullion either as my dad is sensitive to salt. But my dad LOVED this tweaked version.
Great recipe. Made it as described and it was a hit. A great low salt (no salt) dish. I used the boiled chicken recipe on here as well.

Very quick and easy. I made it exactly as written the first time. I now reduce the bouillon cubes to 5 and add 4 cups of non salted chicken broth in place of the water. 
Great recipe.

We really liked this -it was awesome! I followed some suggestions to use a rotisserie chicken and 8 cups of stock plus some bouillon with4 cups of water. I used Reames frozen noodles which adds a lot in my opinion, and about a half teaspoon of poultry seasoning. Will definitely make again.
use about 1/4 of the pepper recommended. good otherwise.
delish!

This recipe is now my only chicken noodle soup recipe . Everyone loved it. My picky grand kids loved it too. The only change I made was I used Wyler's Chicken powder because I did not have the chicken bouillons. I will use chicken broth or Wyler's chicken powder in this recipe the next time I make it because in prior recipes the chicken bouillons made the taste too salty and the Wyler's was perfect . Other than using Wyler's I added more celery and carrots and cooked for about an hour . I used medium egg noodles which was added at the end for the last 10 minutes of cooking time.
Love this recipe.

Amazing flavor considering the relatively short time the soup simmered. I used a rotisserie chicken from Costco, which yielded about five cups of meat. Will probably make it a couple more times this winter.
The only real change I made is that I didn't add the chicken until the last 10 or 15 minutes. I feel that the chicken gets tough if it is added too soon to the soup.

I Love Chicken Soup and this recipe is similar to mine, but since I'm on a Low-Sodium Diet I used IMAGINE Free Range Chicken Broth (Low Sodium) – 3,360mg Sodium in 6 Cubes is WAY too much for me. Plus like other readers/cooks I used a Rotisserie Chicken to make it easier and faster, and it Tastes Great!!
I LOVE this recipe! The only change I made was to use Better Than Bullion instead of bullion cubes. This will definitely be a "go-to" recipe for my family on a cold day!!

Very delicious for our family Fall gathering. I increased the carrots (sliced) and celery (sliced) to make it more chunky. I used Swanson Chicken broth because I think it is more flavorful. I chose the large wide noodles. This will be my easy go to soup in the future.

Delicious and easy! I cooked the chicken in the same pot, otherwise followed the directions exactly. Next day leftovers were even better! My new favorite go-to chicken soup recipe! Thank you for sharing
This soup was true comfort food.
i loved it! this recipe was easy and tasty. i added cayenne pepper to give it a kick and that made a huge difference for me too. overall, great soup!!
Very easy receipe to follow. I made it with the tomatoes instead of spinach, just to be different.

My PICKY children LOVED this soup! They all went back for seconds. I am very happy. It was a simple and easy to follow recipe and turned out fantastic. I too followed to suggestion to use broth and rotisserie chicken, and to double the vegetables. This is now part of the meal plan.
Very sleazy recipe. I used 1/2 chicken broth, 1/2 water. Instead of bullion cubes I used Wyler’s chicken powder. Thanks for the recipe
Best chicken soup ever!!! I’ve made other recipes for chicken soup in the past but this one tops them all!
I added a while vidalia onion and some Ground Cardomon. Was a hit with my picky kiddo and was something I will fix regularly for family get togethers.

I kid you not, this is the best chicken noodle soup I have ever had! it has become a family favorite, and every time I make it for someone else they ask for the recipe. the only thing I do differently is the marjoram. I didn't have it the first time I made it, and it was so good I never tried to add it.
Delicious!! I followed the recipe and added a bag of frozen corn like someone suggested. I followed other chicken noodle soup recipes before but this one is a keeper!
Delicious!! I followed the recipe and added a bag of frozen corn like someone suggested. I followed other chicken noodle soup recipes before but this one is a keeper!
This recipe is really good and super easy. I cut the recipe in half and added a lot more carrots, onions, and celery (about 1/2 cup each). Would definitely recommend, especially for cold wing nights.
Absolutely love this recipe it’s simple but it’s so tasty, I would definitely pass this recipe it came out perfect.
It was easy and amazing! My husband and I made it today! We loved it!
Great recipe. I prepped the chicken on the Traeger with a 2 hour smoke, and added 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 1/2 teaspoon oregano, and a sprinkle of dill weed. Soup turned out great!
Very good recipe. Wife and I really liked it and will be making again.

I have made this soup several times with great success. Usually I boil my chicken and shred it and add to the soup. I make it in my crock pot. This time because of the virus pandemic I could only get thin sliced chicken breast. So I sliced it and cut it up into pieces and threw the raw chicken In the pot. The chicken cooked in the broth and was delicious. Everyone who has ever tried my soup loves it!
Best pot I ever made. I am still getting compliments!

I make this in our 7qt crockpot & it's full to the brim. 
After 4-6 hrs on low, served with warm, fresh French bread. Mmmm good!
 
Did make a few adjustments though. 
Instead of water I use chicken stock. Also used 3Tbs of Better than Bouillon paste mixed in 1c of hot water, instead of the bouillon cubes. 3 cans of Kirkland (Costco brand) chicken breast chunks liquid & all. Carrot sticks, chopped in 1/2in sq. (Only for ease of preparation)
This is the only chicken noodle soup recipe I make.
Everything is in the right proportion. I made this for my ailing wife and she loved it too. I will be making this soup again.

BEST chicken noodle soup I have ever had! My family was literally licking the bowl when they were done eating! I added chicken thighs and breasts and about 1/2 lb more than the recipe called for (my fam are serious meat eaters) but other than that I followed the recipe just as written.

I was feeling a bit under the weather so made this soup today. I used leftover rotisserie chicken that I had on hand. Like some other reviewers I used Reames frozen noodles. This soup was so good and such a comfort food! It has good flavor and I enjoyed it. Looking forward to another bowl for my lunch tomorrow!
I made it just like the recipe and it was awesome! I asked my husband how he would rate it and he rated it an 8 or 9.
Great recipe - family loved it! (Used rotisserie chicken.)
I added a beef boyan cube with the chicken.. no complaints
I made this soup from leftover roast chicken for my fellow workers, they immediately said this good...They were asking me for the receipt... Great meal!
Amazing!
I made this twice in the last few weeks. No changes. Absolutely the BEST chicken noodle soup I have ever had, hands down. Don’t change a thing, amazing!!!

my family loved this! I used leftover rotisserie chicken, added extra carrots and celery. I also had about 2 cups of chicken broth that I threw in and it turned out amazing. my husband and i love to top it with crispy fried onions which makes it over the top for us. It gets better every day you eat it and we can typically get 2 to 3 meals out of this.
Love this recipe!

For our taste I would use less chicken. My half recipe I will cut down to 6oz raw chicken to begin. Also will use less noodles. My dry measure read 12 oz and I will reduce to 8 oz dry. Great taste though.

AMAZING!!! tastes just like how my mom used to make except better. i did 6 cups of chicken broth and 6 cups of water instead of the 12. i also added green onions and they were delicious! will make again (:
Turned out well. I did add 1/2 tsp or so of poultry seasoning and used 4 cups of stock and 2 boxes of broth instead of chicken bouillons. The family loved it.

Was super delicious. Lots of flavor. I did use the suggestion of using a whole already baked chicken. Shredded the meat off and added. I did add about 1 tsp. Of dry garlic pieces. My family aren’t very big on soup, but this one every one wanted seconds. Will be making again

One of the best chicken soup recipes I've ever used. Incredibly flavorful and filling. I will defiantly use this recipe again. I added a little salt, but other then that used the recipe just as listed.
Really good! Made this for a friend when she had the flu. I would replace the water and bouillon cubes with chicken broth and then add salt to taste, and definitely more veggies! :)
I used 6 cups chicken broth and 6 cups water. Added some garlic salt when I sautéed the veggies. Turned out lovely! Thank you!
Not good. No flavor. Threw it all out.

This recipe is simple...and amazing.
I added a twist
.. used Better Than Bullion and added 2 fresh cloves of garlic.
Try it.

The stock has flavor and the bigger noodles make this soup hearty and a great stand alone meal on a cold autumn day.
Loved it! Perfect in flavor! I always seemed to forget the herbs before.
Very tasty. Needed a little more seasoning, but we enjoyed it very much
By far the best chicken soup I have ever had! Anybody who gave this a horrible review has no clue. Especially if they used the word "chix" instead of "chicken". HA!
a really good recipe!!! i will make this again!
I absolutely love this. It’s simple and flavorful. I make it all the time.
It turned out great. Will definitely make again.
That was amazing thank you so much
It’s wonderful and delicious too, although I put too much pepper in the soup. Just perfect for the crisp fall weather!
I always make the noodles separately, and add them to each serving pre-cooked. That way, the noodles do not get gloopy in the soup!
My first time making Chicken Soup. It came out wonderful. Mine was a bit thicker as I only made half a batch and used a little more noodles and less water. The seasoning ratio was perfect.

Absolutely delicious flavor. I made the recipe exactly as shown. My noodles were a bit mushy. I suggest making the broth and letting it develop. Add the noodles a few minutes before serving. Very easy to make and wonderful flavor. I served it with French bread.
Great recipe. Used low sodium chicken broth and water for a better sodium balance. Added a touch of sage and extra carrots and fresh mushrooms. It's a keeper!
Best chicken noodle soup and it’s so easy to make it yours. Like everyone, I make a few changes.

This recipe is pretty basic and bland. I did use bone broth instead of bouillon cubes which is healthier, more flavorful, and has much less sodium, but the seasonings for this fell short. I'm disappointed in the huge amount of bland soup I have left over, but I'm going to try to jazz it up with more herbs and spices.
My whole family loved it! Thank you!
The best! Super easy and always make when I’m feeling sick.

I used rotisserie chicken from Costco to make this recipe. In lieu of the bouillon, I opted to make my own bone broth which adds several extra hours of cook time to the recipe. It’s worth it though. Trim off all the meat and set aside. Cook the rotisserie carcass in water salted with sea salt, fresh cracked peppercorns, a few bay leaves, a red onion, carrots, and a few garlic cloves. After simmering for several hours, strain everything off. Then proceeded to make the recipe as suggested. It was very delicious.
Loved it. Followed the directions exactly and it was wonderful!

My family loved this soup, so yes, I'll be making it again! I didn't have Marjoram on hand, so I substituted Oregano (use a tad less than what's called for because Oregano has a little stronger taste). I also didn't have egg noodles so I used, cut spaghetti, which is probably what I'll always use. Thank you, Sherry, for this great recipe!
Perfect! I used the Better than Bullion roasted chicken base instead of the cubes because it’s what I had on hand but it came out perfect!
I used 8 cups of chicken broth and 4 cups of water in place of the 12 cups of water and 3 chicken bouillon cubes instead of 9. Turned out well.
Delicious soup!! I use Amish noodles!
This was my first time making homemade chicken noodle soup. So good! I cut back on the water for a soup with more product and substance.
I love this recipes and make it often when I have leftover chicken. I like my soup thick so I add extra carrots and pasta, but otherwise I follow the recipes exactly.

I'm not normally a chicken noddle fan unless the broth is made from scratch, but this was the best alternative I've found to date. 

I do increase the carrots, and every time I make it I remember when its done that I should increase the water/bouillon a bit too. It's a hearty soup and needs a little more broth. 

I don't like my noodles mushy so rather than add them to the soup I cook them separate and add them to my bowl when I'm ready to eat.
My husband loved this soup. Instead of bouillon I used chicken broth but otherwise I followed the recipe. Easy to make and great flavor!

Used a rotisserie chicken from Costco. Removed the meat and then boiled the carcass with celery to get all remaining meat off the bones. Had no marjoram, and I used dehydrated minced onions. Soup was outstanding! My husband came up from the basement to see what was cooking, saying he could smell it downstairs and it smelled soooo good!
